snippet: Mr. Aamer, a Saudi citizen and British resident whose detention drew protests from human rights advocates and rock stars, was flown to London.

byline.contributor: Charlie Savage reported from Washington, and Steven Erlanger from London.
byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and STEVEN ERLANGER

abstract: Shaker Aamer, Saudi citizen and British resident kept at Guantanamo Bay prison in Cuba for over 13 years, is freed and sent home to England; Aamer, one of most high-profile cases at Guantanamo, was accused by military officials of being terrorist leader, claim human rights advocates dispute.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Mr. Aamer, a Saudi citizen and British resident whose detention drew protests from human rights advocates and rock stars, was flown to London.

headline.main: Shaker Aamer Is Released From Guantánamo Prison After 13 Years
